js
class Example {
  #privateField = 42;

  #privateMethod() {
    console.log('This is private');
  }

  publicMethod() {
    console.log(this.#privateField); // ✅ OK
    this.#privateMethod();            // ✅ OK
  }
}

const e = new Example();
e.publicMethod();

// ❌ These cause errors:
console.log(e.#privateField); // SyntaxError
e.#privateMethod();           // SyntaxError
